Drone strikes reduce civilian harm and protect soldiers, aligning with humanitarian principles.

evidence.text: The International Court of Justice has recognized targeted killings as permissible under Article 51 of the UN Charter when necessary for self-defense, provided they meet principles of distinction and proportionality.

warrants.text: Legal recognition by the ICJ establishes that compliance with self-defense principles makes drone strikes legitimate.
